alert.note: Alert for Moore (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 9:56PM CST until February 26 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Franklin TN, Lincoln and Moore. * WHEN...Until 345 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 950 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This replaces the Flash Flood Warning for northern Lincoln, Franklin, and Moore Counties. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winchester, Fayetteville, Lynchburg, Decherd, Estill Springs, Petersburg, Tims Ford Lake, Sewanee, Lois, Mulberry, Marble Hill, Hurdlow, Booneville, Smithland, Kelso, Mimosa, Lexie Crossroads, Harmony, Belleville and Molino. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
